lines.gurmukhi: suqn ky ipqw Ar BRwqn ky BRwqw Bey Bwmn Bqwr hyq jnnI ky bwry hYN
lines.transliteration_english: Soutan Kay Pitaa Ar Bhraatan Kay Bhraataa Bhaay , Bhaaman Bhataar Hayt Jananee Kay Baaray Hain ?

Shabad OS B.translation: My wondrous beloved master is son of sons, brother of brothers, beloved husband of wife and mother of child.

lines.gurmukhi: bwlk kY bwl buiD qrun sY qrunweI biRD sY biRD ibvsQw ibsQwry hYN
lines.transliteration_english: Baalak Kai Baal Budhi Taroun Sai Tarounaaee , Bridh Sai Bridh Bivasadaa Bisadaaray Hain ?

Shabad OS B.translation: He is childlike with children, youngman among the youth, old with elderly people.

lines.gurmukhi: diRst kY rUp rMg surq kY nwd bwd nwskw sugMiD rs rsnw aucwry hYN
lines.transliteration_english: Drisat Kai Roop Rang Surat Kai Naad Baada , Naasakaa Sougandhi Ras Rasanaa Ouchaaray Hain ?

Shabad OS B.translation: He is beautiful to look at, listener of the musical melodies, relishers of fragrances and utterer of sweet words with his tongue.

lines.gurmukhi: Git AvGit nt vt AdBuq giq pUrn skl BUq sB hI qY nRXwry hY ]579]
lines.transliteration_english: Ghati Avaghati Nat Vat Adabhout Gati , Pooran Sakal Bhoot Sabh Hee Tai Nyaaray Hai ?579?

Shabad OS B.translation: Like a performer of strange acts, the beloved master is existing in strange form both in and out of the bodies. He is present in all bodies and yet is separate from all.  (579)
